Usage: gs abort [flags]

Abort an interrupted operation

Cancels an ongoing git-spice operation that was interrupted by a git rebase or
git merge. For example, if 'gs upstack restack' encounters a conflict, cancel
the operation with 'gs abort', going back to the state before the operation.

The command works with both rebase and merge operations, automatically detecting
which one is in progress.

Global Flags:
  -h, --help                       Show help for the command
      --version                    Print version information and quit
  -v, --verbose                    Enable verbose output ($GIT_SPICE_VERBOSE)
  -C, --dir=DIR                    Change to DIR before doing anything
      --[no-]prompt                Whether to prompt for missing information
      --restack-method="rebase"    Method to use for restacking (rebase or
                                   merge) (ðŸ”§ spice.restack.method)
